channel.title: Eric Ebbesen
channel.description: Eric is privileged to practice test-driven development for a living.

item.title: Getting started with CartoDB
item.description:
CartoDB is one of several free sites where you can upload, visualize and share data using maps. Let’s create a CartoDB account and upload a dataset.

Sign up for a CartoDB account

Create an account using an existing email address or Google account here.

Upload a dataset

You probably already have data that you’re interested in. If not, you can browse the CartoDB data library (look for ‘Data library’) or [Data.gov][data-gov]. If you cannot think of anything that interests you, you can use the Ramsey County census block shape files.

  • Download a dataset that interests you
  • Click the New Dataset button on the CartoDB datasets page
  • Drag your csv, zip or other data file into the upload area and wait as the data is uploaded and processed. This can take several minutes so be patient.
  • Click Map View to see your data visualized on a map

Having trouble visualizing your dataset?

It is possible your data is not in a format CartoDB can understand. This is typically the case if your dataset does not have data in the column named the_geom and/or does not include clearly defined latitude and longitude columns.

Next

Future posts will cover conversion strategies for making your data compatible with CartoDB.
